title: No method to set the timeout for distributed Gloo backend
body_html:
Gloo has a default timeout of 30 seconds, which can be too low depending on the application.

Currently, it's impossible to change this timeout from Pytorch, since the corresponding DataChannel does not expose any method to do so, even though Gloo has a setTimeout method.

I would love to help with this issue, if I can get some guidance on how to properly expose the change. Possibilities could be:

  • Providing a set_timeout function in torch.distributed
  • Add an optional timeout argument to torch.distributed.init_process_group

Related to #3615.

body:
Gloo has a default timeout of 30 seconds, which can be too low depending on the application. 

Currently, it's impossible to change this timeout from Pytorch, since the corresponding [DataChannel](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/lib/THD/base/data_channels/DataChannelGloo.cpp) does not expose any method to do so, even though Gloo has a [setTimeout](https://github.com/facebookincubator/gloo/blob/master/gloo/context.cc) method. 

I would love to help with this issue, if I can get some guidance on how to properly expose the change. Possibilities could be: 
* Providing a `set_timeout` function in `torch.distributed`
* Add an optional `timeout` argument to `torch.distributed.init_process_group`

Related to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3615.
